timeline.bodyText: so you use two different parsers? Can't you standardize on one?
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

replies.bodyText: This has implications for the ddlog-sql compiler. Right now, that code expects DDL in Presto's dialect, which is why I have to convert from Presto's dialect here (and therefore need the Presto parser).
replies.author: lalithsuresh

timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

timeline.bodyText: This is not checked, but I guess you will get an exception anyway if it's not just a table.
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

replies.bodyText: Yes, I'm hoping it'll fail anyway.
replies.author: lalithsuresh

timeline.bodyText: other people put the else on the same line with the }
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

timeline.bodyText: "not supported" sounds a bit better than "unsupported"
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

timeline.bodyText: this line occurs in every function, maybe you can make it a separate method and do some nicer error handling?
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

replies.bodyText: getTargetTable() and getFrom() are not abstract methods, so it won't be easy to have a single method to do this. I've added an instanceof check to the beginning of each visit method.
replies.author: lalithsuresh

timeline.bodyText: do you want to lift getTargetColumnList out of the loop?
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

timeline.bodyText: This is a linear search. Could become expensive if you have many fields. You could build a hashmap with this information...
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

timeline.bodyText: what does this do, concatenate the arrays?
timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw

replies.bodyText: It should, it doesn't, and good catch. :) I'll add a test that exercises this case.
replies.author: lalithsuresh

replies.bodyText:
Actually, now that I look at the code, there's no change necessary. It just returns the matchExpressions[] array, which by the time that call returns, would have traversed every "EQUALS" node.
I still need to add a test for this case. Will do that in the updated PR.
replies.author: lalithsuresh

timeline.author: mbudiu-vmw
